section.title: Installing and Configuring oVirt Engine Reports

step.para: Use yum to install the oVirt Engine Reports package, engine-reports, if you did not already do this when performing the datawarehouse installation. This package must be installed on the system that the oVirt Engine is installed. You must be logged in as the root user.
You must run this command as the root user on the system hosting the oVirt Engine.
For the oVirt Engine Reports installation to take effect it is necessary to restart the jbossas service. The engine-reports-setup command asks you:
step.screen: In order to proceed the installer must stop the JBoss service Would you like to stop the JBoss service? (yes|no):
step.para: Type yes and then press Enter to proceed. The command then performs a number of actions before prompting you to set the password for the oVirt Engine Reports administrative user ( rhev-admin). Note that the reports system maintains its own set of credentials.
step.screen: Please choose a password for the admin user (engine-admin):
step.para: You will be prompted to enter the password a second time to confirm it.

section.para: oVirt Engine Reports have been installed successfully. Access oVirt Engine Reports at http://demo.redhat.com:8080/engine-reports, replacing demo.redhat.com with the fully qualified domain name of the oVirt Engine. If during oVirt Engine installation you selected a non-default HTTP port replace 8080 with the port chosen.

Use the username engine-admin and the password you set during reports installation to log in for the first time. Note that the first time you log into oVirt Engine Reports a number of web pages are generated, as a result your initial attempt to login may take some time to complete.
